items.summary: Lower prices alone aren't enough for electricity distributors in states—They need stable power at all times, and they do not want to worry about battery supply issues in the future. The answer is right before them: Good old coal, costly and polluting, but reliable as ever.

items.title: Luxury car sales slow down amid global, cost bumps
items.summary: Luxury car sales in India experienced a significant slowdown in 2025, growing by only 1.6% to 52,000 units due to geopolitical uncertainties, volatile markets, and currency depreciation. Despite this, industry leaders anticipate a return to sustainable growth in 2026, bolstered by GST reforms and improved macroeconomic clarity.

items.title: NARCL bids Rs 345 crore for Kurukshetra Expressway debt
items.summary: Kurukshetra Expressway (KEPL) is currently facing debt recovery proceedings after its toll project on the Rohtak-Bawal section of National Highway-71 in Haryana was terminated. The concession agreement was cancelled in July 2021 following prolonged disruptions and stoppage of toll collections.

items.title: India set for rapid industrial and warehousing realty boom
items.summary: Manufacturing-led policies, improving infrastructure, and changing distribution methods will help maintain strong absorption, with occupiers focusing on faster turnaround times and large high-quality facilities, investment firms and industry experts said. The sector saw 26.5 million square feet of leasing in the first nine months of 2025, according to commercial real estate services firm Colliers. This was an 11% rise over the same period last year.

items.title: Jupiter Hospital, Reliance-backed co in race for Mumbai SevenHills
items.summary: Two companies are vying to buy SevenHills Healthcare. NK Holdings, backed by Reliance, and Jupiter Hospital have offered similar amounts. The hospital faces a long legal dispute over land compensation. Creditors are reviewing the bids. The Visakhapatnam hospital was recently sold.

items.title: Experts warn of risks from govt price floor on key pharma inputs
items.summary: The government has proposed to impose MIP on Penicillin-G (Pen-G), with possible extension to 6-aminopenicillanic acid (6-APA) and amoxicillin.  Penicillin-G is not a standalone product. It is the upstream 'mother molecule' for a wide range of essential antibiotics, feeding into intermediates such as 6-APA, GCLE and 7-ADCA, and into high-volume formulations including amoxicillin, ampicillin, multiple cephalosporins and widely used combinations.

items.title: High-end housing developers go for integrated development as homebuyers show preference for convenience
items.summary: Of late, developers such as DLF, Hero Realty, M3M, Tribeca and Central Park have been integrating boutique retail developments as part of their projects. According to a JLL study, mixed-use townships are fuelling 35% of residential absorption in major cities by blending living, retail, office and entertainment spaces.

items.title: Jindal Cement steps up expansion, plans 4x capacity jump
items.summary: Jindal Cement is embarking on an exciting journey of growth as it prepares to quadruple its production capacity to 10 million tonnes. This ambitious plan is supported by a considerable investment of approximately ₹3,000 crore over the next two to three years, aimed at enhancing the output from its Raigarh and Angul plants.

items.title: At WTO, India calls for steps to boost tech transfer to developing nations
items.summary: India is pushing developed nations at the World Trade Organization to share advanced technologies. This move aims to boost trade for developing and least-developed countries. India highlights barriers like export controls and intellectual property rules. The goal is to ensure a fair share in global trade. This initiative seeks to address global inequalities and promote economic growth for poorer nations.

items.title: Toyota posts a drop in sales in November, dragged down by China
items.summary: November brought a setback for Toyota, as global sales and production figures fell, primarily due to a steep decline in the Chinese market following the end of subsidies for electric and fuel-efficient vehicles. Despite increases in production in Thailand and the United States, markets in China, Japan, and the UK reported negative trends.

items.title: Dept of Atomic Energy seeks sops to put nuclear power on a par with renewable energy
items.summary: The Department of Atomic Energy is pushing for tax breaks and green incentives for nuclear power. This aims to put nuclear energy on par with solar, wind, and hydro power. The department wants GST waivers and access to green financing. Nuclear projects currently face higher taxes and environmental classifications that slow progress.

items.title: Rail passenger fare hike from today
items.summary: Indian Railways has increased passenger fares by up to 2 paise per kilometer, effective Friday. Sleeper, AC, and non-AC classes will see a 1 paisa per km hike for non-mail/express trains, while mail/express fares will rise by 2 paise per km. Fares for suburban services and season tickets remain unchanged.

items.title: CERC brings in virtual PPA norms for renewable targets
items.summary: India's power regulator has launched a new virtual power purchase agreement framework. This allows large electricity users to meet renewable energy goals without physically receiving green power. Companies can now enter non-tradable contracts with renewable generators. This eases compliance, supports generator revenues, and offers consumer flexibility. The mechanism links generators and consumers financially, not physically.

items.title: Jewellery, rugs and toys power creative goods' export surge
items.summary: India's creative goods exports saw a significant rise in the first seven months of FY26. Fashion accessories, jewellery, carpets, and toys led this growth. The UAE emerged as the primary destination for these shipments. This expansion highlights India's growing role in the global creative industry. Crafts and design manufacturing showed strong performance. Lab-grown diamonds are gaining traction in fashion jewellery.

items.title: Train fares hiked from December 26: Railway Ministry notifies new ticket prices, here’s how much more passengers will pay
items.summary: Passenger train fares have been officially notified with revised ticket prices effective December 26. Fares are increased by 1 paise per kilometre for ordinary class journeys beyond 215 km and by 2 paise per kilometre for non-AC mail/express and all AC classes. Suburban services and season tickets remain unaffected.

The government is urged to review Free Trade Agreements to boost exports and integrate Indian firms into global value chains.

Sleeper and first class ordinary fares rise by 1 paise per km, and AC and non-AC Mail/Express by 2 paise per km. Extra charges remain the same, and the changes apply only to tickets booked from December 26.

items.title: Thermal plants' biomass shortfall in FY25 due to supply challenges, not intent: APP
items.summary: The Association of Power Producers (APP) attributes thermal power plants' inability to meet biomass co-firing targets to limited availability and technical issues, not a lack of effort.  The industry faces challenges with underdeveloped torrefied biomass pellet markets and supplier capacity.  APP urges the government to consider waivers for genuine difficulties.

items.title: Delivery workers call for nationwide strike on December 31
items.summary: The workers are demanding higher pay, job security, safer working conditions and access to social security benefits

items.title: Indian exporters can help New Zealand cut China dependence, boost shipments: GTRI
items.summary: Indian exporters across various sectors have significant potential to increase shipments to New Zealand, helping the island nation reduce its reliance on China. Despite a bilateral free trade agreement, India's current share in New Zealand's imports is minimal across key categories like agriculture, petroleum, and apparel, indicating a largely untapped market.

items.title: India food regulator 'spills the tea' on what counts as the real thing
items.summary: The FSSAI has mandated that only beverages derived from Camellia sinensis can be labelled as "tea" in India. This clarification aims to prevent misbranding and consumer confusion by prohibiting the use of the "tea" label for herbal or plant-based infusions not originating from the specified plant.  Food businesses must comply with these stricter labelling and packaging norms.

items.title: Herbal or plant-based infusions cannot be labelled as ‘Tea’: FSSAI
items.summary: It pointed out that only beverages derived from Camellia sinensis including Kangra Tea, Green Tea & Instant Tea can be labelled as Tea

items.title: Mint Explainer | Can battery scrap secure India’s rare earth future?
items.summary: As India chases rare earth security, policymakers are turning to an unlikely source: waste. Battery scrap and used magnets are emerging as a strategic supplement to mining. Here's a dive into India's gameplan

items.title: With more than 18 FTAs so far, India must shift focus to deliver export gains amid tough 2026 trade outlook: GTRI
items.summary: The report said India's total exports stood at $825 billion in FY25 and are expected to rise only marginally to around $850 billion in FY26, reflecting a challenging global trade environment

items.title: Budget 2026-27: CII proposes 4-point fiscal plan to strengthen India’s macroeconomic stability
items.summary: Recommends debt cap at 54.5% of GDP, deficit at 4.2%; calls for AI-led tax expansion and deeper institutional reforms

items.title: Vision IAS penalty: CCPA fines ed-tech firm  ₹11 lakh for misleading ads about student performance in UPSC exams
items.summary: Vision IAS penalty: CCPA has imposed a  ₹11 lakh fine on ed-tech company Vision IAS for misleading advertisements about its students' performance in the UPSC exams. Here's what the authority found after its investigation.

items.title: magicpin forays into metro ticket booking space
items.summary: First-time users booking metro tickets through the magicpin app will also get a ticket for free, along with a cashback

items.title: Bengaluru entrepreneur says  ₹4 crore in taxes made him quit ‘building in India’ dream; vows to leave in 2026
items.summary: In a post on LinkedIn, Bengaluru-based entrepreneur Rohit Shroff said that he has paid around  ₹4 crore in taxes in terms of GST and income tax “to a country that looks at its most compliant contributors with suspicion by default”.

items.title: Delhi’s pollution and Goa’s tragedy point to a ‘soft state’: For Indian tourism to boom, fix this first
items.summary: A horrific blaze in Goa’s Arpora was symptomatic of India’s weak capacity to enforce rules. This calls for a mindset change to fulfill our tourism potential. Budget tourism, especially religious travel, could yield huge gains if we devote attention to this segment.

items.title: Restaurant chain Nandhana Palace in funding talks with Pulsar, others ahead of planned IPO
items.summary: The Dubai-based private equity firm is looking to fold the Bengaluru-based restaurant chain into a larger food platform as investor interest in mid-sized dining brands accelerates.

items.title: Signature Global to invest Rs 4,800 crore on new housing project in Gurugram
items.summary: Signature Global, which emerged as the fifth-largest listed realty firm last fiscal in terms of sales bookings, has recently launched a new project, 'Sarvam at DXP Estate', spread over 13.56 acre.

items.title: Delhi-Mumbai Expressway delay: Pune's RSIL could soon lose contract over "absolute non-performance"
items.summary: As the Delhi–Mumbai Expressway edges closer to yet another deadline revision, the standoff between the highways authority and its contractor showed the execution challenges facing large public infrastructure projects. For NHAI, the priority now is to prevent further slippage on a corridor seen as central to improving connectivity and freight movement across western India.

items.title: Driven by stronger fundamentals, Tier II/III boom, retail sector set for accelerated growth in 2026
items.summary: The Indian retail industry, valued at approximately $1.1 trillion, is marked by rapid digital integration, expansion into smaller towns, and significant mall development

items.title: Automation reality: AI job losses are a leadership failure, not a technology problem
items.summary: It isn’t technology that takes jobs. It is the decisions taken by leaders as they adapt their businesses. AI should be viewed not as a tool to cut jobs but as an enabler of higher-value tasks so that trust replaces fear among employees. Examples abound of companies that have adopted AI well.

items.title: What qualifies as ‘tea’? FSSAI clarifies
items.summary: The food safety regulatory body issued a clarification saying a beverage qualifies to be tea only if it is derived from the plant Camellia sinensis

items.title: Driven by stronger fundamentals, Tier II/III boom, retail sector set for accelerated growth in 2026
items.summary: India's retail sector is set for strong growth in 2026. Demand is shifting to smaller cities, boosting the market. Digital integration and new mall developments are key drivers. Experts predict double-digit growth, with technology and consumer focus shaping the future.

items.title: India's medium and heavy commercial vehicles entering the next upcycle
items.summary: The Indian medium and heavy commercial vehicle industry is poised for an upcycle, with volumes projected to grow 8% in FY26 and 10% in FY27. Improving fundamentals like rising freight rates, GST benefits, and aging trucks are driving replacement demand and fleet operator profitability, signaling a sustained recovery.

items.title: India to chair Kimberly Process for ‘conflict-free’ diamond trade from Jan 1 2026
items.summary: This will be the third time India has been entrusted with the chair of the Kimberley Process

items.title: Nihar Info launches Amazon Inter-State Xpress Delivery programme
items.summary: The new program aims to enhance delivery efficiency and reduce costs by leveraging automated inventory management, as Nihar Info expands its logistical footprint across key Indian states

items.title: Smallcap, midcap stocks struggle behind blue-chip peer Sensex this year; outlook cautiously optimistic
items.summary: According to market analysts, smaller stocks are generally bought by local investors, while overseas investors focus on blue-chips or large firms

items.title: India’s rural employment guarantee offered the poor a job security net that’s about to weaken
items.summary: This employment scheme’s revision is likely to push market wages down and slow a rural revival

items.summary: The coming year will test whether the labour codes can deliver the balance they promise: security for workers, flexibility for employers, and a framework suited to a changing economy.

items.summary: On Thursday, the Navi Mumbai International Airport started its commercial flight operations. The airport will handle 15 scheduled departures on the first day. IndiGo has also announced that it has commenced operations from Navi Mumbai Airport. From February next year, operations are planned to progressively scale up to round-the-clock services.

items.title: Vedanta Sesa Goa achieves 8 million units of energy savings via smart systems, tech upgrades
items.summary: Vedanta Sesa Goa has achieved significant energy savings. Nearly 8 million units were conserved in FY'25 and the current fiscal. This was done through technology upgrades and in-house innovations. The company is committed to sustainable mining and clean energy. Initiatives include waste heat recovery and solar power adoption. Electric vehicle wheel loaders are also reducing diesel consumption.

items.title: India revamps tax regime in 2025, new I-T Act to take effect from April 1
items.summary: Next year will see the new simplified Income Tax Act, 2025, to come into effect from April 1, replacing the over six-decade-old current Income Tax Act, 1961

items.title: India likely to miss $1 trillion export target in FY26 as global slowdown hits shipments: GTRI
items.summary: India is unlikely to achieve the ambitious target of USD 1 trillion in exports of goods and services in FY26, with global slowdown and protectionism weighing on merchandise shipments, economic think tank Global Trade Research Initiative (GTRI)on Wednesday.

items.title: India may miss the $1 trillion export target of FY26 as shipments lose momentum: GTRI
items.summary: $1 trillion export target for FY26 is increasingly unattainable due to sluggish growth in goods exports and a need for strategic trade agreements, despite signs of market diversification, says GTRI

items.title: India revamps tax regime in 2025, new I-T Act to take effect from April 1
items.summary: India revamped its tax system in 2025, slashing Goods and Services Tax rates and increasing income tax exemptions. The focus now shifts to simplifying customs duties and procedures. These reforms aimed to boost domestic demand and economic growth. The Goods and Services Tax overhaul simplified the indirect tax structure. Income tax relief was provided to middle-income earners.

items.title: Air India Express debuts operations at Navi Mumbai International Airport, among the first airlines to launch direct flights
items.summary: Air India Express has launched flights from the new Navi Mumbai International Airport. The airline is operating direct services to Bengaluru and Delhi. This marks a significant step for Mumbai's aviation capacity. Air India Express plans to increase flight frequencies in the coming year. The airline is also enhancing its cabin experience on its aircraft.

items.title: Toyota Posts Rare Sales Drop in November, Dragged Down by China
items.summary: Toyota Motor Corp.’s sales and production fell in November, weighed down in large part by a sharp drop in China as the country discontinues subsidies meant to boost the sales of electric and fuel-efficient cars.

items.summary: India's theatrical business anticipates a balanced 2026, with increased box office collections and a diverse range of films succeeding. The rise of regional and mid-budget films indicates a shift in audience preferences, moving beyond reliance on big blockbusters and embracing original narratives.

items.summary: Market regulator Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) has further simplified the procedure for issuing duplicate securities certificates to enhance ease of investment, strengthen investor protection, and promote dematerialisation.

items.summary: Trading activity across key Indian stock exchanges halts for the festive occasion, with markets set to reopen on December 26, while global counterparts have mixed schedules for post-Christmas trading

items.summary: Navi Mumbai International Airport (NMIA) commenced commercial operations with its first IndiGo flight from Bengaluru touching down at 08:00 hrs, followed by its inaugural departure to Hyderabad. items.title: Private banks lead small business lending; PSBs lost share in last 2 years: Report
items.summary: The report noted that while private banks remain the primary lenders to enterprises, non-banking financial companies (NBFCs) are steadily gaining share, particularly among sole proprietors, where they now command over 41 per cent of the lending share.

items.summary: IndiGo has issued a travel advisory warning passengers of potential flight disruptions in Bengaluru due to dense fog and low visibility. The airline is closely monitoring weather conditions and assisting affected passengers, urging them to check flight status regularly. This advisory comes amidst broader fog-related disruptions across northern India.

items.title: India at inflection point: Seizing leadership in changed global trade landscape
items.summary: Global trade is reaching a pivotal moment, shaped by the US-China rivalry and the effort for dependable supply chains. To step into a leadership role, India should quickly address internal challenges like improving logistics and skills.

items.title: J&K Bank wins ‘Best MSME Bank’ at MSME Banking Excellence Awards 2025 in New Delhi
items.summary: Jammu and Kashmir Bank received top honors at the MSME Banking Excellence Awards 2025. The bank was named 'Best MSME Bank' and secured the runner-up position for its CSR initiatives. Union Minister Piyush Goyal presented the awards. J&K Bank is committed to supporting entrepreneurs and aligns its initiatives with national development goals.

items.title: Startups turn concierges as India’s affluent are ready to pay to have life play to their tune
items.summary: Emerging startups are redefining personal concierge services for India's affluent, moving beyond traditional human roles. Swiggy's Crew and Pinch Lifestyle offer tailored assistance to high networth individuals and affluent professionals in a market projected to grow to $2-3 billion.

items.title: Bank holiday today: Are banks open or closed on December 25 for Christmas? All you need to know
items.summary: Bank holiday today on Christmas 2025: India is celebrating Christmas on 25th December, Thursday, along with the rest of the world. One of the biggest festivals across the world, Christmas is celebrated as a national holiday in India, which is why banks will be closed today.

items.title: ISRO’s commercial success is clear but its strategic aims require it to focus on talent retention

items.summary: Under the deal, Nvidia will buy Groq's every asset excluding its nascent Groq cloud business, which will continue to operate “without disruption”, the startup which makes AI accelerator chips said in a blog post, without giving the financial details of the transaction.

items.title: Mint Quick Edit | AI and jobless growth: Why US monetary policy may start resembling India’s
items.summary: As AI snaps the last “Phillips Curve” link between jobs and price levels, the US Federal Reserve’s policy might need its targets reset. Since relaxing its inflation goal will hit the dollar, shifting its other aim may make sense. Either way, its policy would look more like India’s.

items.title: SEBI simplifies procedure for issuing duplicate securities, raises limit to ₹10 lakh
items.summary: Investors holding securities up to ₹10 lakh now need to submit fewer documents, using a standardised Affidavit-cum-Indemnity Bond, while those with holdings under ₹10,000 can submit a simple undertaking on plain paper.

items.title: SEBI revises BSDA rules: Simplified demat accounts from March 2026
items.summary: Depository participants must review all accounts quarterly and convert eligible accounts to BSDA by default, unless investors explicitly opt for a regular demat account

items.title: CESL concludes tender for 10,900 electric buses under PM E-Drive scheme
items.summary: The mega tender drew strong industry interest, with 16 bidders participating and 14 qualifying technically

items.title: BSNL to shut down 3G, end legacy vendor contracts for better 4G
items.summary: With 92.2 million subscribers, only 22 million of whom are on 4G, the transition faces hurdles regarding handset compatibility and network stability.

items.summary: Carlyle-backed Hexaware has argued that the inventions it is accused of infringing, as claimed by Natsoft, are not patentable under US law.

items.title: Why 2026 could mark a payoff year for India’s economy
items.summary: After tariffs, floods and global shocks, India may be nearing a reform payoff. Economists see 2026 delivering the lagged gains of tax relief, rate cuts and regulatory changes—despite external risks.

items.title: Non-bank funding grows faster as India Inc cuts reliance on bank credit
items.summary: India Inc is increasingly diversifying its funding by tapping equity markets and corporate bonds, reducing reliance on traditional bank loans. This shift reflects a structural move towards market-based financing amid a rate easing cycle. Overall credit to the commercial sector rose 13.2% to ₹290.38 lakh crore, with non-bank sources surging 17%.

items.title: Growing, but not adding up: The AI revenue paradox for TCS, Accenture
items.summary: Generative AI is the fastest-growing segment at firms like TCS and Accenture, but experts warn it may be replacing legacy IT revenue rather than adding new business.

items.title: India's petrol pump network surpasses 100,000; third-largest after US and China
items.summary: India's petrol pump network has surpassed 100,000 outlets, nearly doubling in the last decade. This expansion has improved fuel access in rural areas and intensified competition. While private players hold less than 10% of the market, concerns exist about the economic sustainability of such rapid growth.

items.title: Bharti Enterprises-Warburg to plug into Haier’s India arm
items.summary: Bharti Enterprises and Warburg Pincus are acquiring a significant stake in Haier India. This partnership aims to boost Haier's competitiveness and expand its market presence. The deal signifies a strategic move to challenge established players like LG and Samsung in the Indian consumer electronics market. This collaboration will leverage global expertise and local networks for accelerated growth.

items.title: Banks seek certification on source of overseas transfers
items.summary: High-street banks are now demanding testimonials on 'sources of funds' from wealthy Indians, NRIs, and businesses looking to move money abroad. This comes as the rupee's slide against the US dollar tempts individuals to remit funds overseas, with banks insisting on CA validation for these transactions.

items.title: Embassy REIT's ₹530-crore deal
items.summary: Mumbai Embassy Office Parks REIT has sold two blocks at its Embassy Manyata Business Park in Bengaluru. The deal, valued at ₹530 crore, involved approximately 376,000 sq ft. EAAA Alternatives' Rental Yield Plus fund acquired the properties.

items.title: Hillhouse joins Temasek in race for up to 6% stake in Quest Global
items.summary: Hillhouse Investment Management is vying with Temasek for a stake in Quest Global. The deal is valued at approximately $4.5 billion. This investment is part of Quest Global's pre-IPO fundraising. A decision on the new investor is expected soon. Quest Global is preparing for a potential IPO and may relocate its headquarters to Bengaluru.

items.title: Budget 2026: Industry seeks faster tax dispute resolution
items.summary: Businesses are pushing the government to fix tax uncertainties and speed up dispute resolution. Unclear rules and treaty issues could lead to more tax cases. Industry leaders want the budget to cut litigation and reform Tax Deducted at Source. A large number of appeals are pending, causing delays.

items.title: India assures safeguards in place on New Zealand apple imports
items.summary: India has granted New Zealand market access for apples under a new trade pact. The agreement includes safeguards to protect local farmers. A concessional duty applies only to a specific quota. Imports beyond this quota will face the full existing duty.

items.title: GI tag, carbon tax & intellectual property rights on top for India in January trade talks with EU
items.summary: India and the European Union are set for crucial trade talks in early January. Discussions will cover geographical indications, critical mineral exports, and the EU's carbon border adjustment mechanism. India's steel export concerns are also on the agenda. Officials are working towards a swift agreement.

items.title: Sebi gives its go-ahead to road ministry’s proposed public InvIT
items.summary: SEBI has approved NHAI's Raajmarg Infra Investment Trust (RIIT), a public InvIT designed to monetize national highway assets and offer retail investors a stake in infrastructure growth. The first issuance is expected in February 2026, with 1,500 km of highways to be introduced over the next three to five years, fostering public participation in national development.

items.title: After cancellations & delays for days, IndiGo says fully prepared to cater to holiday season demand

items.title: Watch: Explained: What are Supplementary Demands for Grants?
items.summary: Every Budget is presented in February and lays out the plan for the government’s spending in the financial year that will start in April that year. This relies on a fair bit of estimation. Once about 8-9 months are past, the government is in a much better state to have an accurate idea of how much it is going to spend in the year. So, in December, it submits what is known as a Supplementary Demand for Grants if it needs more money.
